applet.name: EnhancedDigitalOutput

applet.name: CustomClock

plugin.name: RadioNowPlaying
plugin.creator: Paul Webster
plugin.changes: - Add ARD (de) stations - but only for song recognition. Launch the streams from ARD Audothek plugin (or Favourites) - artist, title and CoverSearch - station groups HR, MDR and NDR (other ARD groups already in RNP with own menu BR, DLF, WDR, SWR, SR, RBB and RB - Add Brian FM (nz) - artist, title, album and cover art - 12 stations but all (perhaps not Reelworld) playing same playlist with slightly offset times - Add Bee Radio (nl) - artist, title and CoverSearch - 2 stations - 1 flac - Add Corus (ca) - artist, title, duration and cover art - more than 20 stations - Add Das Total Erlebnis (nl) - artist, title, album, duration and cover - Add Dhectar (fr) - artist, title and cover art (CoverSearch only for secondary station) - 2 stations - primary has flac (but not working in LMS for unknown resaon for now) - Add Hawkesbury Radio (au) - artist, title, album, duration, cover art (on primary station) - 2 stations - primary has flac (but LMS does not like it) - secondary stattion is sports with no extra data - Add ISEKOI Radio - artist, title, album, duration and cover art - programme name and duration - 3 stations including flac - Add KMGN 93.9 The Mountain - Flagstaff, AZ - artist and title already present, plus CoverSearch - Add Nora Webstreams (de) - artist, title, cover art - 5 stations - another in the regiocast.de family. Like many of their stations, the timings are often off by around 40 seconds. - Add Panacea Radio - artist, title and CoverSearch - programme name and, although unlikely to be seen, duration with icon - Add Radio La Belle Aventure - artist, title and cover art - Add Special Sound Radio - artist, title, duration, cover art - includes flac stream - their song metadata is not always tidy - Add Stereo Anime - artist, title, album, duration, cover art - includes flac - Add Supposed To Rot Radio - artist and title already present - album, cover art, duration - includes flac - Add Violent Forces Radio - artist, title, album, duration and cover - 2 stations, one with flac - Add W Radio (co) - programme title, subtitle (presenter), synopsis, duration and icon - Add Yammat (hr) - artist and title already present, plus CoverSearch - programme title on news breaks - Add YouRadio - artist, title already present, add CoverSearch - over 1200 stations - For 95bfm (nz) - added programme title and duration - For beeRadio (nl) - flac stream has gone - For Coast 101.1 (ca) - stream URL changed which also removed he song info so back to parsing web page for it - For Le Bon Mix (fr) - they have removed some stations - only 3 now - For Nova (fr) - add Nova La Plage, remove Nova Lyon and update station logos - For rne (es) - allow extra field to be used as subtitle to help differentiate between consecutive programmes with same title - For WCPE - add AAC stream - For WJIB - Cambridge, MA - use the given start time to be more accurate on song changes - also remove extraneous information from song title - For WYPR - Baltimore, MD - stream URLs changed - Logo moved or changed - FBi Radio (au), Juice - Belfast, Naim Radio, SLAM! (nl), TransePulse (ie), Ultimix (fr) - Station disappeared - Top Tonic (fr) - Update station list - radioboss.fm, RegioCast (de) station groups (80s80s, 90s90s, Feier Freund, Radio BOB!) - Experiment with changing polling interval when duration is known and ignore duration if guessing start time (when using datapaths) - done for WJIB but will affect others - Some changes made to station matching process as part of adding YouRadio which might have side-efects

plugin.name: AutoRepo
plugin.creator: Erland Isaksson
plugin.desc: Automatically makes all third party plugin repositories that are listed on the Logitech wiki site available through Extension Downloader. The plugin doesn't actually read the wiki page directly since that would open up a security hole, instead it reads the repositories from a list available on the lms-autorepo GitHub project. New repostories added to the wiki page will be added after they have been checked so they provide serious plugins and not spam urls. (Boom, Transporter, Classic, Receiver, Controller, Radio, Touch, SoftSqueeze, SqueezePlay)
plugin.title: Auto Repositories

plugin.name: TrackStat
plugin.creator: Erland Isaksson
plugin.changes: - Added support for SqueezeCenter 7.4 - Corrected so internet meta data is shown correctly on Now Playing screen if one of the TRACKSTAT title formats is used - Added possibility to request parameters from top rated albums and most played album playlist templates for SQL Playlist - Added predefiend SQL Playlist playlists for playing top rated or most played albums in a genre, artist or year - Improved logic releated to finding moved tracks on multi disk albums when a TrackStat backup is restored
plugin.desc: Store statistics such as rating, last played time and play counts so it survives a rescan and allows to to browse your library based on the statistic information. You can set the ratings via the Squeezebox player, CLI, Squeezebox Controller or web interface, ratings and statistic data can also be imported/exported from/to iTunes, Amarok and MusicIP Mixer. It also supports Dynamic Playlist plugin by adding dynamic playlists for all its statistics. Please note that TrackStat needs a bit more resources than small plugins and might also slow down startup of SqueezeCenter a bit, so you might get problems if you are running SqueezeCenter on slow hardware. (Boom, Transporter, Classic, Receiver, Controller, Radio, Touch, SoftSqueeze, SqueezePlay)
plugin.title: TrackStat

plugin.creator: Watkins, Peter
plugin.changes: 2.1.28: allow use in LMS 8.* (untested); 2.1.27: fix minor UI glitches, minimum increment now 15 seconds; 2.1.25: squelch deprecation warnings in 7.4; support --noweb; 2.1.24: *really* remove CGI.pm dependency for newer SqueezeCenter releases; 7a21: fix some API calls, make it possible to start with ContextMeu when player is off; 7a18: can now be used as When Playing or When Stopped screensaver
plugin.desc: This plugin allows you to set simple countdown timers. Timers can be given names and saved for later re-use. Timers can be shortened or extended if needed. Includes a countdown screensaver designed for use with SaverSwitcher (only displayed if there's an active timer). (Boom, Transporter, Classic, Squeezebox1, Slimp3, SoftSqueeze)

plugin.desc: This plugin allows you you to log the tracks you listen to, either automatically or by pressing a few remote control buttons. plugin.name: SaverSwitcher
plugin.creator: Watkins, Peter
plugin.changes: 2.1.31: allow use in LMS 8.* (untested); 2.1.30: work in 7.4, and be less aggressive about trimming mode stack; 2.1.28: remove CGI.pm dependency for newer releases; 7a27: performance/efficiency change suggested by andyg; 7a26: more aggressive Activate Screensaver for ContextMenu; 7a23: ContextMenu fixes; 7a21: fix bug that kicked users back into screensaver mode; more quickly and accurately notice saver pref changes; don't mess with animations if the screensaver isn't changing; 7a19: try to keep client mode stack trim so switching modes (off/active/idle/playing) doesn't result in long delays
plugin.desc: Configure multiple screensavers for the When Off, When Playing, and When Idle modes, either having SqueezeCenter cycle through a number of plugins or allowing you to change screensavers with a single button press. Easily change screensavers, or immediately jump to the When Playing screensaver, if used with ContextMenu. Can display "conditional" screensavers, as with KitchenTimer (set a screensaver to display onlly if it has something to report). (Boom, Transporter, Classic, Squeezebox1, Slimp3, SoftSqueeze)
plugin.title: SaverSwitcher

plugin.desc: Provides a Web interface for copying settings from one player to another, permanently "linking" settings on multiple Squeezeboxes, setting defaults for newly connected Squeezeboxes or remote /stream.mp3 clients, and importing/exporting client settings, to make it easier to manage multiple Squeezebox players. (Boom, Classic, Receiver, Slimp3, SoftSqueeze, Squeezebox1, Transporter)

plugin.title: AutoRescan

plugin.name: AutoRescan
plugin.creator: Stuart Hickinbottom
plugin.desc: AutoRescan is a plugin that will detect changes to your music folder and will automatically trigger a rescan if any files have been added, removed or changed. This means changes to appear in your music library automatically. Note that Windows users need to be running a 'source code' version of Squeezebox Server under ActivePerl - see the plugin website for further details.
plugin.title: AutoRescan

plugin.name: SugarCube
plugin.creator: Charles Parker
plugin.desc: Travel through your music Library using MusicIPs recommendations. Features Include Filter, Genre, Artist and Recipe Mixing, Trackstat Integration, Artist Blocking, Genre Blocking, Custom Track Weighting Routines, Coming Up Next Display, Sleep Mode, Volume Fade and lots more. See www.spicefly.com for Details and Change Log.
plugin.title: Spicefly SugarCube
